availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand. Kentucky native. Son of George J. Ingram and Mary M. Ingram. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from October 15, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 344A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 102.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 516.
"George Felix Ingram (1844-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial #62432565, accessed May 17, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62432565.
